query: I need information of "The acts restricted by copyright in a work"
response:
**The acts restricted by copyright in a work** (as set out in the UK *Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988*, Section 16) are the exclusive rights that the owner of the copyright holds.  In other words, anyone who does any of these acts **without the copyright owner’s licence** is infringing the copyright.

| # | Act | How it is typically understood |
|---|-----|--------------------------------|
| **a** | **Copy the work** | Making a duplicate of the original (digital or physical). |
| **b** | **Issue copies of the work to the public** | Distributing copies to the public (e.g., selling, giving away, making available on the internet). |
| **c** | **Rent or lend the work to the public** | Allowing a person to use the work for a period of time (e.g., renting a DVD, lending a book). |
| **d** | **Perform, show or play the work in public** | Publicly performing music, showing a film, performing a play, or playing a game in a public venue. |
| **e** | **Communicate the work to the public** | Transmitting the work so that a member of the public can access it (e.g., streaming, broadcasting, posting online). |
| **f** | **Make an adaptation of the work (or any of the above in relation to an adaptation)** | Altering, translating, remixing, remixing a work or creating a derivative that incorporates any of the above acts. |

These six categories are collectively referred to in the Act as **the “acts restricted by the copyright.”**  In Section 16(2), the Act states that the copyright is infringed whenever any of these acts are performed **without the licence of the copyright owner.**

> *“Copyright in a work is infringed by a person who, without the licence of the copyright owner, does, or authorises another to do, any of the acts restricted by the copyright.”*  

(UK C&DPA 1988, § 16(2))

These provisions form the core of the exclusive rights that copyright holders enjoy over their works in the United Kingdom.

28  Introductory provisions 
 
(1)     The provisions of this Chapter specify acts which may be done in relation to
